item.title: In Sudan’s Hell, a Glimmer of Light From Charity Volunteers
item.description: Almost three years into Sudan’s devastating war, estimates put the death count at over 150,000, more than 21 million people are facing acute hunger and in 2025 alone, of the total population of 46.8 million, a staggering 30.4 million people need humanitarian aid. Amid the unreliability in international aid reaching civilians in Sudan, the heroes ... Read more

item.title: The Fight Against Femicide: Victories and Setbacks in 2025
item.description: Hours before world leaders gathered in Johannesburg for the 2025 G20 summit in November, hundreds of South African women wearing black lay down in a city park for 15 minutes — one for each woman who loses her life every day to gender-based violence in the country. The striking visual protest was organised by a […]
